page.title: 04GEOGRAPHY (2)
page.content: {LANDSCAPE}The general landscape is one of a large housing estate{Speke}which has been built on a various types of land cover such as farmland, woodland and heath. The estate spreads and stretches towards the village of{Hale, which is generally open farmland and now has two small housing estates. By{May 1985}there are no sheep or cattle, some pigs are now being kept, the fields forming arable land with grain, and root crops with some bulbs and flowers. Scattered among the fields can be seen the remains of some of the woods and plantations. Three percent of the land is within the tidal flow and is now subject to casual marsh, although the drainage is now being improved. The River section contains polluted sands and eroding mudbanks. { }
